content:
{
  "name": "ts-js-path-resolve",
  "version": "0.0.9",
  "description": "When TS compiler for path resolving use the tsconfig.json file, it isn't correctly work after compiling, couse nodejs require doesn't nkow how find module. This ismplementation use the NODE_PATH hack to add new path where nodejs should search for modules.",
  "repository" :
  { "type" : "git"
  , "url" : "https://github.com/killroy192/ts-js-path-resolve.git"
  },
  "main": "./dist/index.js",
  "types": "./index.d.ts",
  "scripts": {
    "build": "tsc",
    "build-watch": "tsc --watch"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "NODE_PATH",
    "TS",
    "module",
    "resolving"
  ],
  "author": "Dzmitry Lahunouski",
  "license": "MIT",
  "devDependencies": {
    "@types/node": "^8.0.26",
    "tslint": "^3.15.1",
    "typescript": "^2.4.0"
  }
}
